meanings.definition: The act or process of growing or developing before something else.
meanings.sent1: The pregrowth of the seeds was crucial for the success of the garden.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the pregrowth of the cells in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The competition had a rule that only allowed pregrowth of plants in the competition.
meanings.sent4: The pregrowth of ideas in her mind led to a brilliant invention.
meanings.sent5: The pregrowth of the caterpillar into a butterfly was a beautiful transformation.

meanings.definition: The state of being grown or developed before something else.
meanings.sent1: The pregrowth of the tree made it stand out in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The early pregrowth of the child's skills impressed the teacher.
meanings.sent3: The bakery had a special section for pregrowth of dough before baking.
meanings.sent4: The pregrowth of technology in that era paved the way for modern inventions.
meanings.sent5: The pregrowth of the city before the arrival of settlers was documented in history books.
